body_html:
A note on numpy broadcast semantics: It's not really specified here as far as I can tell (https://docs.scipy.org/doc/numpy-1.10.0/user/basics.broadcasting.html), but:

For non-inplace operations, broadcasting works across both tensors (i.e. [1,3] X [3,1] becomes [3,3] so expand/expandAs on a single tensor isn't sufficient)

For in-place operations, broadcasting only works on the non-ouput tensor (i.e. [1,3] X [3,1] gives you "ValueError: non-broadcastable output operand with shape (1,3) doesn't match the broadcast shape (3,3)" and [3,3] X [3,1] works.
body_text:
A note on numpy broadcast semantics: It's not really specified here as far as I can tell (https://docs.scipy.org/doc/numpy-1.10.0/user/basics.broadcasting.html), but:
For non-inplace operations, broadcasting works across both tensors (i.e. [1,3] X [3,1] becomes [3,3] so expand/expandAs on a single tensor isn't sufficient)
For in-place operations, broadcasting only works on the non-ouput tensor (i.e. [1,3] X [3,1] gives you "ValueError: non-broadcastable output operand with shape (1,3) doesn't match the broadcast shape (3,3)" and [3,3] X [3,1] works.
body:
A note on numpy broadcast semantics: It's not really specified here as far as I can tell (https://docs.scipy.org/doc/numpy-1.10.0/user/basics.broadcasting.html), but:

For non-inplace operations, broadcasting works across both tensors (i.e. [1,3] X [3,1] becomes [3,3] so expand/expandAs on a single tensor isn't sufficient)

For in-place operations, broadcasting only works on the non-ouput tensor (i.e. [1,3] X [3,1] gives you "ValueError: non-broadcastable output operand with shape (1,3) doesn't match the broadcast shape (3,3)" and [3,3] X [3,1] works.
